title: Synthetic Recap
body:
DALLAS – On a night where the scoreboard mattered little in the grand scheme of a long season, the basketball world bore witness to a singular, historic force of nature. Michael Finley of the Dallas Mavericks didn't just play a basketball game; he authored a masterpiece, carrying his team to a 104-96 victory over the Sacramento Kings with a career-defining 42-point eruption.

From the opening tip, Finley was uncontainable. He attacked the rim with ferocity, hit from mid-range with cold-blooded precision, and stretched the Kings' defense to its breaking point. While Sacramento’s Mitch Richmond provided a valiant 25-point counter-punch, and teammate Chris Webber added a quiet 14 points, their efforts were mere background noise to the Finley symphony. Every time the Kings threatened to close the gap, Finley had an answer—a silky jumper, a powerful drive, an and-one opportunity that silenced the visitors.

His 42 points were not just a season-high; they were a statement, a landmark performance that instantly became part of Mavericks lore. The rest of the Dallas roster played its role perfectly, with George McCloud and A.C. Green combining for 27 points, but this was Finley’s night above all else.

In the end, the final score of 104-96 will reside in the record books. But the true story of this game was written by one man. Michael Finley didn't just win a game for the Mavericks; he delivered a performance for the ages, a brilliant, 42-point declaration of his arrival among the league's elite scorers. It was a night Dallas will not soon forget.
